attributes.action: Stop banning breeds, Ban bad owners instead and licence good owners.
attributes.additional_details:
We want to see the stopping of certain dog breeds being banned. Dogs are not inherantly dangerous, as a professional in the Vetirinary industry I can safely say that there are no such thing as ‘dangerous’ or ‘bad’ breeds, only ‘dangerous’ or ‘bad’ owners, that willingly teach their dogs to be violent, or mistreat the dog in such a way it becomes violent due to the nature of it’s surroundings. 

If a human was being mistreated and acted out in violence, we’d offer them support, not ban them, so why don’t we do this for dogs?
attributes.background: Create a dog licence that would have to have certain criteria met to ensure owners are not violent and will provide the dog with a kind, nurtering and ultimately safe home. This would lead to the decrease in animal related violence as the animals wouldn’t be taught aggression or act out in fear.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions which call for similar actions: 

https://moderate.petition.parliament.uk/admin/petitions/643650
Bring back a Dog Licence

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/638509
Remove breed specific legislation. Consider alternative methods for dog control
